description.narrative: National and districts authorities have improved ability to develop and implement effective tools, strategies, protocols, legislations, plans and budget to prevent and respond to child deprivations, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, aged 0-5, in targeted districts, with a focus on the first 1,000 days, benefit from early learning, caring, nurturing, a clean and protective environment and quality, integrated, high-impact interventions.

participating-org.narrative: LILONGWE UNIVERSITY OF AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES
MINISTRY OF GENDER CHILDREN AND SOCIAL WELFARE
MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND POPULATION SERVICES

sector.narrative: Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
